conclusion: Calculate the electric field at point A due to charges at cube vertices.
Point O is the midpoint of the line connecting charges 2q and -q.
Distance from each charge to point O is L√2/2.
Electric field due to point charge q at distance r is E = kq/r².
Electric field due to charge 2q at O: E_2q = 4kq/L².
Electric field due to charge -q at O: E_-q = -2kq/L².
Net electric field at O is E = 2kq/L².
Given magnitude at O is E = 2kq/L².
Point A is a vertex of the cube, distance L√3 from both charges.
Electric field due to charge 2q at A: E_2q = 2kq/3L².
Electric field due to charge -q at A: E_-q = -kq/3L².
Net electric field at A is E_A = kq/3L².
Substitute kq into E_A expression: E_A = E/6.
Magnitude of electric field at A is E/6.
